article.title: Measuring the magnetic field of a trans-equatorial loop system using coronal seismology

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of data is shown in panel b of Figure 1?
What instrument was used to acquire the data shown in Figure 1?
What does the dashed line above the limb in Figure 1 represent?
choices: The location of a coronal loop
The direction of the solar wind
The height at which data is extracted in Figure 3
The boundary of an active region

multiple_choice_question.text: What phenomenon is shown in Figure 2?
What does the white dashed line in panel d of Figure 2 represent?
choices: The leading edge of the propagating pulse
The trajectory of a coronal loop
The boundary between two different regions of the corona
The location of a shock wave

multiple_choice_question.text: What information is plotted on the vertical axis of panel b of Figure 2?
What physical quantity is shown in panel a of Figure 3?
What is the approximate period of the oscillation observed in the Doppler velocity (panel b)?
What causes the drop in intensity observed in the AIA PBD measurements (panels e & f)?
choices: The expansion of the coronal loop system
The evacuation of material by the CME
The absorption of light by the erupting filament

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the different panels in the left column of Figure 4 represent?
choices: Doppler velocity at different heights in the corona
Magnetic field strength at different heights

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the approximate damping time of the oscillation observed in the Doppler velocity (right column)?
What does the blue-shifted feature observed at approximately 23:05 UT in panel b represent?
choices: The initial expansion of the coronal loop system
The impact of the wave-pulse on the loop system
The propagation of a shock wave

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of analysis is shown in Figure 5?
Which IMF in the Doppler velocity (left panels) best captures the oscillatory behavior of the loop system?
What is the purpose of the residual signal shown in red in each panel?
choices: To show the remaining signal after removing the IMFs
To represent the average value of the original signal

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of plot is shown in Figure 6?
What does the intense red strip around 1 mHz in the left panel represent?
choices: The oscillatory component of the Doppler velocity captured by IMF=3
The high-frequency noise in the data

multiple_choice_question.text: Why does the HHT spectrum for the AIA PBD intensity (right panel) show more complexity compared to the CoMP measurements?
choices: AIA is less sensitive to changes in the corona
AIA has a higher cadence, capturing more time-scales
AIA observes a different region of the corona
The AIA data is affected by more noise

multiple_choice_question.text: What physical quantity is used to estimate the magnetic field strength in Figure 7?
What is the approximate range of magnetic field strength estimated in the lower right panel?
Why is the 10798 Å line weaker than the 10747 Å line in the corona?
choices: The 10798 Å line is absorbed by the solar wind
The 10798 Å line is more sensitive to density, which is lower in the corona
The 10798 Å line is emitted at a higher temperature, which is less common in the corona
The 10798 Å line is scattered by dust in the corona

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of model is shown in Figure 8?
Which magnetogram provides a higher estimate of the magnetic field strength in the legs of the loop system?
choices: It is not possible to tell from this figure

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the approximate magnetic field strength estimated at the loop-top in both extrapolations?
